body_html:
Hello,
For example
Input Xi i=1..N samples
Xi=[y1,..yk..., yT] T= 50 (sequence length)
with yk= [yk1, ... ykm]

So, we have
Xi size : (m, 1toK_char_size, NsequenceSize)
i=1... Nsample
sequenceSize= 50 or 100
1toK_char_size= 50
m= 1 or 2 or 3 (max)

Tensor Ranks is 3 (4 if we account with the samples).
Now, size of the tensor is just:
m=1, (1toK_char_size, NsequenceSize)

So m>1 , it would be very helpful for new architectures.
Thanks for replying.

So m>1 , it would be very helpful for new architectures.
Thanks for replying.
body:
Hello,
For example
Input Xi i=1..N samples
     Xi=[y1,..yk..., yT]                      T= 50 (sequence length) 
     with yk= [yk1, ... ykm]      

So, we have 
Xi size :   (m,  1toK_char_size, NsequenceSize)
   i=1... Nsample
   sequenceSize= 50 or 100
   1toK_char_size=  50 
   m= 1 or 2 or 3 (max)

Tensor Ranks is  3  (4 if we account with the samples).
Now, size of the tensor is just:
    m=1,        (1toK_char_size, NsequenceSize)

So m>1 , it would be very helpful for new architectures.
Thanks for replying.
